Package se.idsec.signservice.integration.process

Class SignResponseProcessingConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.idsec.signservice.integration.process.SignResponseProcessingConfig
  • public class SignResponseProcessingConfig
extends Object
    Configuration for processing a SignResponse message. This class represents the "static" configuration settings. Also see the SignResponseProcessingParameters class that is parameters supplied by the caller.
    Author:
    Martin Lindstr√∂m (martin@idsec.se), Stefan Santesson (stefan@idsec.se)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static long DEFAULT_ALLOWED_CLOCK_SKEW
      The default for the allowed number of milliseconds that we allow our clock to differ from the SignService clock.
      static long DEFAULT_MAXIMUM_ALLOWED_PROCESSING_TIME
      The default time we allow for processing at the server side.
      static long DEFAULT_MAXIMUM_ALLOWED_RESPONSE_AGE
      The default for the maximum allowed age for a response given in milliseconds.

      static SignResponseProcessingConfig defaultSignResponseProcessingConfig()
      A SignResponseProcessingConfig with default settings.
      long getAllowedClockSkew()
      The allowed number of milliseconds that we allow our clock to differ from the SignService clock.
      long getMaximumAllowedProcessingTime()
      The allowed number of milliseconds that we allow processing at the server side to go on, that is, the time from when we sent the request until we received the response.
      long getMaximumAllowedResponseAge()
      The maximum allowed age for a response given in milliseconds.
      boolean isRequireAssertion()
      Flag telling whether we require the assertion from where the user authenticated for signature to be present in the sign response.
      boolean isStrictProcessing()
      Flag that tells whether the processing and validation steps should be "extra" strict and look for every little thing that deviates from the specifications.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_MAXIMUM_ALLOWED_RESPONSE_AGE

        public static final long DEFAULT_MAXIMUM_ALLOWED_RESPONSE_AGE
        The default for the maximum allowed age for a response given in milliseconds. 3 minutes.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_ALLOWED_CLOCK_SKEW

        public static final long DEFAULT_ALLOWED_CLOCK_SKEW
        The default for the allowed number of milliseconds that we allow our clock to differ from the SignService clock. 1 minute.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_MAXIMUM_ALLOWED_PROCESSING_TIME

        public static final long DEFAULT_MAXIMUM_ALLOWED_PROCESSING_TIME
        The default time we allow for processing at the server side. Default is 10 minutes.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • isStrictProcessing

        public boolean isStrictProcessing()
        Flag that tells whether the processing and validation steps should be "extra" strict and look for every little thing that deviates from the specifications. The default is false. Turning on this setting is mainly intended for testing of a SignService, and should not be active in a production setup.
        Returns:
        whether to use strict processing or not

      • setStrictProcessing

        public void setStrictProcessing​(boolean strictProcessing)
        Flag that tells whether the processing and validation steps should be "extra" strict and look for every little thing that deviates from the specifications. The default is false. Turning on this setting is mainly intended for testing of a SignService, and should not be active in a production setup.
        Parameters:
        strictProcessing - whether to use strict processing or not

      • getMaximumAllowedResponseAge

        public long getMaximumAllowedResponseAge()
        The maximum allowed age for a response given in milliseconds. The default is 180000L.
        Returns:
        maximum allowed age for a response

      • setMaximumAllowedResponseAge

        public void setMaximumAllowedResponseAge​(long maximumAllowedResponseAge)
        The maximum allowed age for a response given in milliseconds. The default is 180000L.
        Parameters:
        maximumAllowedResponseAge - maximum allowed age for a response

      • getAllowedClockSkew

        public long getAllowedClockSkew()
        The allowed number of milliseconds that we allow our clock to differ from the SignService clock. The default is 60000L.
        Returns:
        maximum allowed clock skew

      • setAllowedClockSkew

        public void setAllowedClockSkew​(long allowedClockSkew)
        The allowed number of milliseconds that we allow our clock to differ from the SignService clock. The default is 60000L.
        Parameters:
        allowedClockSkew - maximum allowed clock skew

      • getMaximumAllowedProcessingTime

        public long getMaximumAllowedProcessingTime()
        The allowed number of milliseconds that we allow processing at the server side to go on, that is, the time from when we sent the request until we received the response.
        Returns:
        maximum allowed server processing time

      • setMaximumAllowedProcessingTime

        public void setMaximumAllowedProcessingTime​(long maximumAllowedProcessingTime)
        The allowed number of milliseconds that we allow processing at the server side to go on, that is, the time from when we sent the request until we received the response.
        Parameters:
        maximumAllowedProcessingTime - maximum allowed server processing time

      • isRequireAssertion

        public boolean isRequireAssertion()
        Flag telling whether we require the assertion from where the user authenticated for signature to be present in the sign response. The default is false.
        Returns:
        whether user assertion is required in the sign response

      • setRequireAssertion

        public void setRequireAssertion​(boolean requireAssertion)
        Flag telling whether we require the assertion from where the user authenticated for signature to be present in the sign response. The default is false.
        Parameters:
        requireAssertion - whether user assertion is required in the sign response
